definitions.definition: (the title given to) a person whose job is to care for people who are ill or injured, especially in a hospital:
examples: He worked as a nurse in a psychiatric hospital.

definitions.definition: a woman employed to take care of a young child or children
to care for a person or an animal while they are ill:
examples: He gave up his job so that he could nurse his mother at home.

definitions.definition: to spend a lot of time taking care of something as it grows or develops:
examples: These young trees were carefully nursed by the head gardener.

definitions.definition: If you nurse an illness or injury, you rest until it gets better:
examples: Robert's in bed nursing a back injury.

definitions.definition: to hold a small child in your arms as a way of making them feel better:
examples: She nursed the crying child on her lap.
